history.content:
I'm currently a second year intended CS. I still have CS70 and I need a certain grade so I want to take other classes before tackling CS70 in summer 2019. After reading another post, I became aware of the 60 or 75 unit cap. I'm in the College of Letters and Science, if this is useful info. I have the following questions:

Does the gpa unit cap include AP/transfer units or only the units we've received for classes we enrolled in through Cal central? I ask this because I took the equivalent of Math 1B and R1B at my local community college last summer to get them out of the way, and these transferred successfully. However, because of other AP and transferred units, I'm currently at 86.6 units, where 50.6 of that is from transferable credit and 36 is from units taken here(the classes on my Cal Central). By the end of this semester, I should have an additional 15 units, putting me at 51 units taken here.

I'm not taking CS 70 yet; I plan to take it in summer 2019. By that time, I'll have an additional 16 units(from Spring 2019), putting me at 67 units finished here at Berkeley. Will I be put on a registration hold for the summer? Will that also put me on a registration hold for Fall 2019 as well because I'll be undeclared until I submit the CS/Data Science declaration forms at the end of summer, in which I'm assuming phase 1 and 2 will have already passed? I want to know these because I want to take certain CS upper division classes in Fall. Thanks!
history.subject: Registration Block for Unit Cap
